snippet: Starbucks, reversing a policy that had allowed customers to openly carry guns in states that allow it, is asking customers not to bring firearms into its stores.
abstract: Starbucks, reversing a policy that had allowed customers to openly carry guns in states that allow it, is asking customers not to bring firearms into its stores and its outdoor seating areas; says it is tired of being thrust onto front lines of nation's debate over guns.
lead_paragraph: Starbucks, reversing a policy that had allowed customers to openly carry guns in states that allow it, is asking customers not to bring firearms into its stores.

headline.main: Starbucks Seeks to Keep Guns Out of Its Coffee Shops
headline.print_headline: Starbucks Changes Course and Asks Its Customers to Leave Their Guns at Home
